item.title: Getting Started with NoSQL Database Called HBase ðŸ’»
item.description: Although Apache Hadoop is popular tool for handling big data but for real-time analytics, we require HBase. HBase is an open-source non-relational, scalable, distributed database written in Java. It is a part of the Hadoop ecosystem and runs on top of HDFS. Applications that require random read-write operations for big data tend to use HBase. This tool provides a set of powerful inbuilt APIs for pulling or pushing data. Further,we can integrate HBase with Apache Hadoopâ€™s MapReduce for tasks such as indexing, analytics, etc.
